name: Upper Lesslie Gulch (Top Down)
description:
Introduction

This canyon is super long and has a crazy slot section. It is located in Leslie Gulch, at the near the beginning of the main canyon. Make sure to bring plenty of rope because there are some decently long rappels. Just so you know the midsection of this canyon is unexplored to my knowledge, so be careful and take precautions.

Approach

You can drive to the scree slope that is at the beginning of the canyon. But you need a vehicle with good clearance and off-roading tires, because the road is more of a lightly used trail.

Descent

I was only able to make it partway down the canyon (not enough rope) but the part we did explore had three rappels (20, 40, and 150 feet).

Exit

Hike on the side of the canyon or have a second car at the upper leslie gulch trailhead.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

If anyone wants to plan a trip to go here with me or wants more photos, send me an email at codyrigg8@gmail.com

Background

The rock here is pretty bad because its compressed ash, so be careful.
